member.name: IAMCertifiedOutputProtection.KeyExchange

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The KeyExchange method returns the graphics driver's certificate.

member.param: Receives a 128-bit random number, generated by the graphics driver. Use this value in the method.
Receives a pointer to a buffer containing the graphics driver's certificate. The method allocates the memory for the buffer. The caller must release the memory by calling .
Receives the length of the buffer returned in VarLenCertGH.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: Invalid state. Possibly the application passed unexpected data, or called methods in the wrong order. If this error occurs, the application should release the current instance of the VMR.
The display device does not support COPP; or the VMR has not connected to a display device yet.
No monitors correspond to the display device. This error can occur if the display mode changes; or the user turns off a monitor or removes a monitor.

member.name: IAMCertifiedOutputProtection.ProtectionCommand

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The ProtectionCommand method sends a COPP command to the graphics driver.

member.param: Pointer to an structure that contains the command.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: Invalid state. Possibly the application passed unexpected data, or called IAMCertifiedOutputProtection methods in the wrong order.
The display device does not support COPP; or the VMR has not connected to a display device yet.

member.name: IAMCertifiedOutputProtection.ProtectionStatus

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The ProtectionStatus method sends a COPP status request to the graphics driver.

member.param: Pointer to an structure that contains the status request.
Pointer to an structure. The method fills this structure with the driver's response.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: Invalid state. Possibly the application passed unexpected data, or called IAMCertifiedOutputProtection methods in the wrong order.
The display device does not support COPP; or the VMR has not connected to a display device yet.

member.name: IAMCertifiedOutputProtection.SessionSequenceStart

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SessionSequenceStart method initiates the COPP session with the graphics driver.

member.param: Pointer to an structure. Fill this structure as described in the Remarks session.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: Invalid state. Possibly the application passed unexpected data, or called IAMCertifiedOutputProtection methods in the wrong order.
The display device does not support COPP; or the VMR has not connected to a display device yet.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IAMCertifiedOutputProtection interface sends Certified Output Protection Protocol (COPP) messages to the graphics driver. This interface is exposed by the Video Mixing Renderer 7 (VMR-7) and Video Mixing Renderer 9 (VMR-9) filters.
For information about using COPP, see Using Certified Output Protection Protocol (COPP).
